dt: {bc}relating to or being members of the armed forces who are not performing or available for military duties
{bc}biologically inert especially because of the loss of some quality (such as infectivity or antigenicity)

pt: {sc}inactive{/sc} {sc}idle{/sc} {sc}inert{/sc} {sc}passive{/sc} {sc}supine{/sc} mean not engaged in work or activity. {sc}inactive{/sc} applies to anyone or anything not in action or in operation or at work.
{sc}idle{/sc} applies to persons that are not busy or occupied or to their powers or their implements.
{sc}inert{/sc} as applied to things implies powerlessness to move or to affect other things; as applied to persons it suggests an inherent or habitual indisposition to activity.
{sc}passive{/sc} implies immobility or lack of normally expected response to an external force or influence and often suggests deliberate submissiveness or self-control.
{sc}supine{/sc} applies only to persons and commonly implies abjectness or indolence.

pt.t: a {it}supine{/it} willingness to play the fool
